Switchboard
Stratify OS » Device Interface

Detailed Description

The switchboard device driver is a device that is used to connect other devices and transfer data in the background.

For example, the switchboard can read data from a UART and write it to a FIFO. It can also implement UART loopback functionality.

It is also well-suited for streaming audio from one interface to another (say from I2S input to a USB audio class endpoint.

The switchboard is configured using ioctl calls.

Reading the switchboard will read a block device populated with the status of the connections.

switchboard_status_t status;
int fd = open("/dev/switchboard", O_RDWR);
while( read(&status, sizeof(status)) > 0 ){
printf("Connection is active:%d\n", status.o_flags != 0 );
}

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_SWITCHBOARD_SETATTR

Sets the switchboard attributes. This IOCTL call is used for configuring connections on the switch board.

1 #include <sos/dev/switchboard.h>
2 #include <fcntl.h>
3 #include <unistd.h>
4 
5 int uart_fd = open("/dev/uart0", O_RDWR);
6 ioctl(uart_fd, I_UART_SETATTR); //set default attributes
7 
8 //now configure the UART in loopback mode
9 int fd = open("/dev/switchboard", O_RDWR);
10 switchboard_attr_t attr;
11 strcpy(attr.input_terminal, "uart0");
12 strcpy(attr.output_terminal, "uart0");
13 attr.o_flags = SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_CONNECT |
14  SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_PERSISTENT;
15 ioctl(fd, I_SWITCHBOARD_SETATTR, &attr); //uart0 is in loopback mode
16 close(fd); //connection persists until disconnected

Typedef Documentation

typedef switchboard_connection_t switchboard_status_t

Data type that describes the data that is read from the switchboard.

1 int fd = open("/dev/switchboard", O_RDWR);
2 switchboard_status_t status;
3 read(fd, &status, sizeof(status));
4 
5 read(fd, &status, 2); //returns an error with errno set to EINVAL

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum switchboard_flag_t
Enumerator
SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_CONNECT 

Configure a switchboard connection (used in o_flags of switchboard_attr_t)

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_DISCONNECT 

Clears the specified connection (used in o_flags of switchboard_attr_t)

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_PERSISTENT 

Set to configure a persistent connection (used in o_flags of switchboard_attr_t)

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_CONNECTED 

Used in o_flags of switchboard_connection_t for status

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_READING_ASYNC 

Used in o_flags of switchboard_connection_t for status

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_WRITING_ASYNC 

Used in o_flags of switchboard_connection_t for status

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_PRIMARY_BUFFER_USED 

Used in o_flags of switchboard_connection_t for status

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_IS_SECONDARY_BUFFER_USED 

Used in o_flags of switchboard_connection_t for status

SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_SET_TRANSACTION_LIMIT 

Use with SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_CONNECT to specify a transaction limit other than the default

Variable Documentation

u32 switchboard_terminal_t::bytes_transferred

Number of bytes transferred on the terminal

switchboard_connection_t switchboard_attr_t::connection

The switchboard connection details.

u16 switchboard_info_t::connection_buffer_size

The internal buffer size (max number of bytes for persistent connections)

u16 switchboard_info_t::connection_count

The total number of connections available

u16 switchboard_connection_t::idx

Connection index of total

switchboard_terminal_t switchboard_connection_t::input

Input device (device that is read)

u32 switchboard_terminal_t::loc

The location of the terminal (block location or channel depending on the device)

char switchboard_terminal_t::name[LINK_NAME_MAX]

The name of the terminal

s32 switchboard_connection_t::nbyte

Number of bytes to transfer (packet size for persisent connections); will be negative when reading to indicate an error

u32 switchboard_info_t::o_flags

Bitmask of supported flags

u16 switchboard_connection_t::o_flags

Bitmask flags for connection state

u32 switchboard_attr_t::o_flags

Flag bitmask such as SWITCHBOARD_FLAG_CONNECT

switchboard_terminal_t switchboard_connection_t::output

Output device (device that is written)

s8 switchboard_terminal_t::priority

Hardware interrupt priority elevation

u32 switchboard_info_t::transaction_limit

The maximum number of synchronous transactions that are allowed before the connection is aborted

u16 switchboard_connection_t::transaction_limit

The maximum number of synchronous transactions that can occur before aborting
